articles.description: Follow live text, in-play video clips and radio commentary as South Africa play Australia in the semi-finals of the Men's Cricket World Cup 2023.
articles.title: South Africa bat first against Australia in World Cup semi-final

articles.description: Women's Champions League and FA Cup reaction, plus build-up to the Euro 2024 qualifiers and all the latest football news.
articles.title: Reaction to Chelsea's controversial Women's Champions League draw

articles.description: Red Bull's Max Verstappen says he is "not looking forward" to this weekend's Las Vegas Grand Prix, which he believes is "99% show and 1% sporting event".
articles.title: Las Vegas GP is 99% show - Verstappen

articles.description: When Morocco beat Spain at last year's World Cup, it was a result that struck at the core of a long, complicated relationship between the two countries.
articles.title: A rivalry heated by history - the significance of Morocco's win over Spain

articles.description: Ex-Charlton striker Kevin Lisbie could not bear to watch as his son Kyrell scores a penalty for Cray Valley Paper Mills to make it 1-1 in the FA Cup.
articles.title: 'Magic of the cup' - Pundit Lisbie can't watch son's penalty

articles.description: "Inaction" by the Qatari government and Fifa on workers' rights is "tainting the legacy" of the 2022 World Cup, according to Amnesty International.
articles.title: 'Workers' rights inaction taints World Cup legacy'

articles.description: Rower Hannah Scott explains how a new women's sport research project has helped stop her breaking her ribs and given her back control of her body.
articles.title: 'I have lost count of how many ribs I've broken'

articles.description: Chelsea manager Emma Hayes says her side were "robbed" of victory by "embarrassing" refereeing in their 2-2 draw with Real Madrid in the Women's Champions League.
articles.title: Chelsea 'robbed' by 'embarrassing' refereeing - Hayes

articles.description: Virat Kohli hits a record-breaking century and Mohammed Shami claims 7-57 to help India book their place in the Cricket World Cup final after a 70-run victory over New Zealand in Mumbai.
articles.title: Kohli and Shami lead India to World Cup final

articles.description: Five-time Olympic champion Elaine Thompson-Herah splits with her coach eight months before she will attempt to defend her sprint titles at Paris 2024.
articles.title: Sprinter Thompson-Herah splits with coach
